title: Rinus Israël
text:
Marinus "Rinus" David Israël (born 19 March 1942) is a Dutch former professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and manager who is currently a scout. Nicknamed "Iron Rinus", he formed a solid defence line at Feyenoord with <a href="Theo%20Laseroms">Theo Laseroms</a>.
Club career.
During his career he played for <a href="AFC%20DWS">DWS</a> (1962–66), <a href="Feyenoord%20Rotterdam">Feyenoord Rotterdam</a> (1966–74), <a href="SBV%20Excelsior">Excelsior Rotterdam</a> (1974–75) and <a href="PEC%20Zwolle">PEC Zwolle</a> (1975–82). Israël achieved his greatest success at club level with Feyenoord, where he won three <a href="Eredivisie">Eredivisie</a> titles, a <a href="KNVB%20Cup">KNVB Cup</a>, a <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">European Cup</a> and a <a href="UEFA%20Europa%20League">UEFA Cup</a>. He scored one of the two Feyenoord's goals in the <a href="1970%20European%20Cup%20Final">1970 European Cup Final</a> against <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a>.
International career.
He also played 47 matches and scored 3 goals for the <a href="Netherlands%20national%20football%20team">Netherlands national football team</a> from 1964 to 1974, and he played three matches for Holland in the <a href="1974%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1974 FIFA World Cup</a>, including the Second round victories against <a href="Brazil%20national%20football%20team">Brazil</a> and <a href="Argentina%20national%20football%20team">Argentina</a>.
